title: Mindy Kaling - Why Not Me? (Audiobook)
description:
From the author of the beloved New York Times bestselling book Is Everyone Hanging Out Without Me? and the creator and star of The Mindy Project comes a collection of essays that are as hilarious and insightful as they are deeply personal.

In Why Not Me?, Kaling shares her ongoing journey to find contentment and excitement in her adult life, whether itâ€™s falling in love at work, seeking new friendships in lonely places, attempting to be the first person in history to lose weight without any behavior modification whatsoever, or most important, believing that you have a place in Hollywood when youâ€™re constantly reminded that no one looks like you.

In â€œHow to Look Spectacular: A Starletâ€™s Confessions,â€ Kaling gives her tongue-in-cheek secrets for surefire on-camera beauty, (â€œYour natural hair color may be appropriate for your skin tone, but this isnâ€™t the land of appropriateâ€“this is Hollywood, baby. Out here, a dark-skinned womanâ€™s traditional hair color is honey blonde.â€) â€œPlayerâ€ tells the story of Kaling being seduced and dumped by a female friend in L.A. (â€œI had been replaced by a younger model. And now they had matching bangs.â€) In â€œUnlikely Leading Lady,â€ she muses on Americaâ€™s fixation with the weight of actresses, (â€œMost women we see onscreen are either so thin that theyâ€™re walking clavicles or so huge that their only scenes involve them breaking furniture.â€) And in â€œSoup Snakes,â€ Kaling spills some secrets on her relationship with her ex-boyfriend and close friend, B.J. Novak (â€œI will freely admit: my relationship with B.J. Novak is weird as hell.â€)

Mindy turns the anxieties, the glamour, and the celebrations of her second coming-of-age into a laugh-out-loud funny collection of essays that anyone whoâ€™s ever been at a turning point in their life or career can relate to. And those whoâ€™ve never been at a turning point can skip to the parts where she talks about meeting Bradley Cooper
